page.title: 09War relics
page.content: The largest war relic in our area is {Paull Battery}.This is a kind of fort which was built during the First World War for the soldiers.There were a great many soldiers billeted at the fort and they came to Paull by ship.There are the remains of the jetties all along the shore used by ships such as HMS Anson to embark the men.The fort was used in the Second World War too as a gun battery and there are the remains of the weapon pits and gun mounts all along the shore.There are a great many tunnels in the battery running all in different directions. All alonf the river bank are the remains of pits which were to look like a fake port so that when the Nazis came to bomb Hull they would bomb the shore instead.
